main event: Observers at Maxwell Field in Montgomery, Alabama sighted a star-like object moving east then south at approximately 2120 Central time on 23 June 1947.
interesting points: The object exhibited frequent bursts of speed while changing direction in a zig-zag manner,The object was brighter than a star but emitted no audible sound,The sighting lasted over 5 minutes before the object was lost in the brilliancy of the moon, The observers were military personnel, including rated pilots and air intelligence officers, The report indicated that no plausible explanation for the object's behavior was found, suggesting it acted contrary to known aerodynamical laws.
witness description: Captains and 1st Lieutenants from air intelligence and tactical air command
